@FantasticalEconomics @SrRochardBunson That said, Friedman was a proponent of the negative income tax as a form of UBI. The core of Capitalism isn’t capital, it was supposed to be competition, and UBI places those competitive pressures in the hands of workers.

(Not that I’m defending capitalism. But that Friedman would be in favor of a UBI solution to some of these crises.)
